intro: Pinguicula dostalii, commonly known as the Mexican butterwort, is a carnivorous plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, sticky leaves that trap and digest insects. The plant belongs to the family Lentibulariaceae and is adapted to grow in moist, nutrient-poor environments. Its leaves are glandular and secrete digestive enzymes to break down prey. Pinguicula dostalii is often cultivated for its unique appearance and ecological interest.
